summary: Automating Payroll Workflow with Custom Terminal Command

content.text:
# Start Payroll Project

Opens terminal with 3 tabs for payroll project development:
1. Frontend tab: `/repos/payroll` running `npm start`
2. Backend tab: `/repos/payroll/backend` running `npm run local`  
3. Claude tab: `/repos/payroll` running `claude`

Then closes the current terminal tab.

```bash
gnome-terminal \
    --tab --title="Frontend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'npm start; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Backend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll/backend" -- bash -c 'npm run local; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Claude" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'claude; exec bash' && exit
```

file.content:
# Start Payroll Project

Opens terminal with 3 tabs for payroll project development:
1. Frontend tab: `/repos/payroll` running `npm start`
2. Backend tab: `/repos/payroll/backend` running `npm run local`  
3. Claude tab: `/repos/payroll` running `claude`

Then closes the current terminal tab.

```bash
gnome-terminal \
    --tab --title="Frontend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'npm start; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Backend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll/backend" -- bash -c 'npm run local; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Claude" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'claude; exec bash' && exit
```

# Start Payroll Project

Opens terminal with 3 tabs for payroll project development:
1. Frontend tab: `/repos/payroll` running `npm start`
2. Backend tab: `/repos/payroll/backend` running `npm run local`  
3. Claude tab: `/repos/payroll` running `claude`

Then closes the current terminal tab.

```bash
gnome-terminal \
    --tab --title="Frontend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'npm start; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Backend" --working-directory="/repos/payroll/backend" -- bash -c 'npm run local; exec bash' \
    --tab --title="Claude" --working-directory="/repos/payroll" -- bash -c 'claude; exec bash' && exit
```
